etymology.description: Depicts a stork -> Now written 鸛(鸛)
etymology.interpretation: The character 雚 originally depicted a stork and has since evolved, with 吅 being added during the Shang dynasty as an additional component. It is now typically written as 鸛(鸛) (guàn, "stork"), but its original pictographic nature as a representation of a stork persists.
